summary: The North Fork 50 Mile/50K is a premier mountain ultramarathon held in the Buffalo Creek Recreation Area of Colorado's Pike National Forest. Starting and finishing near the town of Pine, the race offers a high-altitude challenge on 100% soft-surface trails that wind through lush ponderosa pines and stark historic burn scars.
uniqueFeatures: Historic Burn Scar Views: The course traverses the sites of the 1996 Buffalo Creek and 2000 High Meadows fires, providing runners with a unique landscape of regenerating forest and unobstructed, panoramic views of granite rock formations.

Fire Department Benefit: A significant portion of race proceeds is donated to the North Fork Volunteer Fire Department, the local agency that fought the very wildfires that shaped the modern course terrain.

Exclusively Ultramarathon: To maintain a dedicated ultra-running community atmosphere and avoid trail congestion, the event deliberately offers no distances shorter than the 50K, focusing entirely on the long-distance experience.
